title: Microsoft Internet Explorer CImgElement Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Microsoft Internet Explorer. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.
The vulnerability relates to how Internet Explorer tracks HTML img elements in a document. By manipulating a document's elements an attacker can force a CImgElement object in memory to be reused after it has been freed. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code under the context of the current process.
addtionnal_details: Microsoft has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/security/ms15-065.aspx
timeline:
2015-04-07 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2015-07-20 - Coordinated public release of advisory
